intro: Grammatocarpus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Grammatocarpus corymbosus and Grammatocarpus scaber. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. They typically grow in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Grammatocarpus species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
